page.title: 16Walk Along Sheerness Beach
page.content: Between the Catamaran Club and school we saw another caravan site and passed the Ship on Shore{Public {House}and the Yacht Club. The pub is supposedly called this because Thames Barges used to be run onto the beach at high tide to be filled with mud at low tide. The mud was then taken to be used for making bricks. The{landscape}now changed as the houses we passed now became older and terraced. The sea wall started here with the{beach}on the other side. The beach has stones and sand and people throw{rubbish}on it as well as that which is washed up by the sea - this makes it untidy but it is nice to go there when it is hot and the water is cold.
